nodes.text: The Caarite holonet was a communications network. Around 21 BBY, the Caarite Thurm Loogg, the envoy of the Metatheran Cartel trade alliance to the Cularin system, made a speech over the Caarite holonet in which he spoke of how the Cartel was prospering by not involving itself in the Clone Wars, a tumultuous conflict between the Galactic Republic and the Confederacy of Independent Systems. Loogg's speech on the Caarite holonet was listened to by the Metatheran Cartel technician Celis Bol.

The Caarite holonet was mentioned in Caaried Away, a roleplaying adventure by Morrie Mullins released in March 2003. The adventure formed part of the Metatheran Caution trilogy of the Living Force campaign, a supplement to Wizards of the Coast's Star Wars Roleplaying Game.
